column4: what do you mean "n-o-t is always closed on the next restart"?  When you right click in nautilus you don't see "open in terminal"?
i did never see this... i missed that function i tried with suse before ubuntu
after installing the nautilius-open-terminal the terminal was in included in the "explorer" upper half was terminal, lower half was file explorer
sorry, i've never seen nautilus-open-terminal as embedded, it's always opened a new terminal window for me?
i'll reinstall and take a screenshot
now it's working fine... lol... thanks anyway
i don't ever remember seeing it embedded, perhaps it wasn't n-o-t but something else that did that?
i restarted nautilus now it's embedded again
i've used n-o-t for years and never seen that behaviour?  strange, well glad it's working for ya.
http://i52.tinypic.com/4hy3o2.jpg that's how it looks until next restart
that's kinda neat, never seen that before.
yeah dunno would be ok for me as long it's running stable ^^
i don't think that stable has anything do to with Ubuntu ;)
